objdescid.compdate: c. 1816-20Since the designs were acquired directly from Blake by John Linnell in 1825, it is possible that they were executed at a slightly later date, c. 1820-25.

objinfo.objsize: ranging between 16.4 x 12.9 cm. and 17.3 x 13.9 cm.
objinfo.medium: pen and water color over pencil
objinfo.watermark: M & J LAY 1816The watermark appears only in Objects 1, 6, and 11.
objinfo.pennednumbers: 2, 2-12The numbers appear below the lower right corner of each design. Objects 1 and 2 are both numbered "2."
objinfo.framelines: 1Each design is outlined at the margins of the image by pen and ink lines.

provenance.name: Fitzwilliam Museum
provenance.note: Possibly commissioned by Thomas Butts c. 1816-20 but acquired directly from Blake by John Linnell in 1825 for £10; sold from Linnell's estate, Christie's, 15 March 1918, lot 151 (£2205 to the Carfax Gallery acting for T. H. Riches); bequeathed by Riches to the Fitzwilliam Museum in 1935 with a life interest to his widow; received by the Fitzwilliam Museum in 1950.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the center of the design facing forward. His feet are submerged in the River Jordan with his left foot raised on tiptoe. The river flows into the Dead Sea behind Christ. Mountains rise above the water in the distance. Christ's arms are down at his sides with the palms turned out to face the viewer. A halo of rosy light radiates from Christ's head; his eyes are raised and he looks toward Heaven. John the Baptist stands to the left of Christ. He is seen from behind with his head turned up and to the right. He wears a belted gown or tunic of animal skins covered in long fur. In his right hand John holds a goblet or pitcher containing the water with which he baptizes Christ. Satan flies above and to the right of Christ; he may be fleeing. He is nude and is seen from behind with his head turned in profile to the right. A serpent flies or hovers near Satan; its tail ends in a single loop below Satan's left foot while its neck and head—also forming a single loop—appears below Satans's right arm. A gowned female stands to the left of John. She faces right and holds an infant in front of her chest with both hands. The infant holds his hands together in prayer. Below, a male child stands facing right with his arms raised vertically and his head bent back. A gowned female stands to the right of Christ with her arms bent upward. Her eyes are raised and she may look at Satan, above. To the right, a gowned male with a long beard stands with his hands held together in prayer. Below, a gowned female(?) child stands facing left with her arms raised vertically. The sky above Christ's head is filled with radiant light. A column of smoke or dark clouds appears to the left of the light, above John's head. Two lightning bolts also appear in the sky, one to either side of the light. The dove of the Holy Ghost descends on outstretched wings above Christ's head.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the center of the design facing forward. He wears a loincloth. He is bearded and his hair is long. His feet are submerged in the river Jordan; his left foot is raised on tiptoe. Christ's arms are down at his sides with the palms, with fingers slightly spread, turned out to face the viewer. A halo of rosy light radiates from Christ's head; his eyes are raised and he looks toward Heaven.

John the Baptist stands to the left of Christ with his right foot on tiptoe. He is seen from behind with his head turned up and to the right. His eyes are raised and he may look toward Heaven. He wears a belted gown or tunic of animal skins covered in long fur. John is bearded and his long, flame-like hair stands on end. His left arm is raised vertically with the palm held vertically. His right arm is raised at 135 degrees and is slightly bent at the elbow. In his right hand he holds a goblet or pitcher containing the water with which he baptizes Christ.
John the Baptist pours water from a goblet or pitcher onto Christ's head. Its looping, spiral shape suggests a trumpet.

Satan flies above and to the right of Christ; he may be fleeing. He is nude and is seen from behind with his head turned in profile to the right. His hair is short and a little curly. His legs are bent with the soles of his feet facing the viewer. Satan's arms are raised in front of him at 135 degrees with the palms turned out (away from the viewer) and his fingers slightly spread.

A serpent flies or hovers near Satan; its tail ends in a single loop below Satan's left foot while its neck and head—also forming a single loop—appear below Satan's right arm. It may be fleeing. The serpent faces right with its mouth open and tongue extended. Its head is topped with a spiky crest. Mottled coloring on its body may suggest scales.

A gowned female stands to the left of John. She faces forward and to the right and looks toward the baptism of Christ. The woman's head is covered by a cloth or scarf. Her right arm is bent and she holds an infant in front of her chest with both hands; her left arm is not visible.

A gowned female holds a nude, male infant to the left of John. He faces forward and to the right and may look toward the baptism of Christ. His legs are together and extend to the left. His right arm is bent with his hands held together in prayer. His hair is short and curly; his genitals are clearly pictured.

A male child stands to the left of John with his left leg slightly bent and his left foot raised on tiptoe. He faces forward and to the right with his head up as he looks toward John and the baptism of Christ. The child's mouth is open and his hair is curly. The child's arms are raised vertically with the right palm held vertically and the left palm turned slightly up; the fingers on both hands are slightly spread. He wears tights or breeches and a shirt. His right foot is prominent. His expression and gestures suggest surprise.

A gowned female stands to the right of Christ. Her garment may be in two parts, a skirt descending from just below her breasts and a blouse or shirt. She faces forward with her torso twisted and bent to the right. Her left foot is visible below the hem of her gown. Her arms are bent upward with the right positioned above her head. Her left hand is held with the palm facing out toward the viewer while her right palm is held vertically. Her mouth is slightly open and she appears to look toward Satan, above. Her expression and gestures suggest surprise.

A gowned male stands at the right border of the design. He is old with long hair and a beard. He faces forward with his head turned slightly to the left; he appears to look toward Christ. The figure's hands are held together vertically in prayer.

A gowned female(?) child stands at the right border of the design. Her left foot is raised on tiptoe. She faces forward and to the left and may look toward Christ. Her mouth is open. The child's arms are raised vertically with the elbows slightly bent; her hands are held above her head with the palms vertical, fingers slightly spread.

Christ stands in the River Jordan while the other figures stand on the grassy shore to his left and right. The river flows into the Dead Sea behind Christ. There are slight indications of small waves in both the river and the Dead Sea. Mountains rise above the water in the distance.
The foreground banks of the river are grassy.

The sky above Christ's head is filled with radiance and a few beams of light. A column of smoke or dark clouds appears to the left of the light, above John's head. Two lightning bolts also appear in the sky, one to either side of the light.
The dove of the Holy Ghost descends on outstretched wings above Christ's head.

lg.l: 2The number "2" in pen and ink may have been written over a partly-erased "1" written in pencil.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands just left of center with his back to the viewer. His head is turned to the right and he may speak with Satan. Christ's left arm is bent upward and he points upward with his left hand. His right arm is bent with his hand held near his right shoulder and he points toward his mouth with his right hand. To the right, Satan stands disguised as an old man. He faces forward with his left arm at his side and slightly bent at the elbow; he points downward with his left hand. His right arm is bent upward with his hand held at about shoulder height. Satan points to his mouth with his right hand. A stone rests on the ground to the right of Satan. Grass covers the ground, extending to the left and right borders of the design. A forest of large leafy trees dominates the background of the scene. There are seven distinct tree trunks; some have slight indications of roots, particularly on the trunk second from the right. Blue wash indicating sky fills the top portion of the design.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the center of the design with his back to the viewer. He wears a gown and his head is surrounded by a halo of light. His hair is long and somewhat curly and he has a beard. He faces right and looks towards Satan. His mouth is open and he may be speaking. Christ's left arm is bent upward and he points upward with his left hand. His right arm is bent with his hand held near his right shoulder. He points toward his mouth with his right index finger, spread away from the other fingers. His left foot is raised on tiptoe.

Satan—disguised as an old man—stands to the right of Christ with his right foot raised on tiptoe. He has long hair and a beard. Satan faces forward with his head turned slightly to the left; he looks at Christ. He wears a short belted gown or a tunic over a shirt. His left arm is down at his side and slightly bent at the elbow; he points downward with his left hand. His right arm is bent upward with his hand held at about shoulder height. Satan points to his mouth with his right hand, fingers spread.
A stone rests on the ground to the right of Satan.
Grass covers the ground, extending to the left and right borders of the design.
A forest of large leafy trees dominates the background of the scene. There are seven distinct tree trunks; some have vague indications of roots, particularly on the trunk second from the right.
Blue wash indicating sky fills the top portion of the design.

desc.objtitle: Andrew and Simon Peter Searching for Christ, Object 3 (Butlin 544.3)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Two gowned males, Andrew and Simon Peter, stand in the center of the design. A small halo of light surrounds each figure's head. The figure to the left is seen from behind; his head is turned up and to the right in profile. He is bearded and has short, curly hair. His arms are bent upward with his palms turned out (away from the viewer) and fingers slightly spread. The figure to the right faces forward with his head turned slightly to the right. He is bearded and has long, curly hair. His arms are held at his side with his palms facing downward and fingers slightly spread. Two gowned and winged angels fly or hover to the left and right of Andrew and Simon Peter. A halo of radiance with beams of light surrounds each angel's head. The angel to the left holds its hands in front of its chest with the palms facing the viewer. The angel to the right holds his hands together in prayer. The ground below the figures is covered with grass. A small plant appears in the lower left corner of the design. The plant appears to have several branches and at least four flower buds or fruits. There is also an indication of vine-like tendrils extending from the plant. A walled city—probably Jericho—appears in the distance behind the figures. Three structures rise above the wall: a rectangular or circular tower appears below the leftmost angel's feet; a triangular structure, possibly a pyramid, is seen between Andrew and Simon Peter; a domed structure appears below the rightmost angel's feet. These may be buildings or the roofs of buildings within the city. Two pairs of palm trees with arching branches grow right and left. Washes in the background indicate a sky at sunrise or sunset.

component.illusobjdesc: Two gowned males, Andrew and Simon Peter, stand in the center of the design. The figure to the left is seen from behind; his head is turned up and to the right in profile and he looks toward the angel to the right. He is bearded and has short, curly hair. A small halo of light surrounds the figure's head. The figure's right leg is bent, and his right foot is visible below the hem of his gown. His arms are bent upward with his palms turned out (away from the viewer) and fingers spread.

Two gowned males, Andrew and Simon Peter, stand in the center of the design. The figure to the right faces forward with his head turned slightly to the right. He is bearded and has long, curly hair. A small halo of light surrounds the figure's head. The figure's feet are visible below the hem of his garment; his right foot (and possibly his left) are raised on tiptoe. His arms are held at his side with his palms facing downward and fingers spread.

A gowned and winged angel flies or hovers near the left border of the design. The figure has long hair and its mouth is open. A halo of radiance with beams of light surrounds the angel's head. The angel faces forward, with its head turned slightly down and to the right; it looks toward the figures of Andrew and Simon Peter. The figure's legs are together and its feet may be touching. The figure's arms are bent upward with the palms turned out toward the viewer.

A gowned and winged angel flies or hovers near the right edge of the design. The figure has long hair. A halo of radiance with beams of light surrounds the angel's head. The angel faces forward with its head turned slightly down and to the left; it looks toward the figures of Andrew and Simon Peter. The figure's legs are together and its feel may be touching. The figure's arms are bent with the palms held together vertically in front of its chest as if in prayer.

A walled city—probably Jericho—appears in the distance behind the figures. Three structures rise above the wall: a rectangular or circular tower appears below the leftmost angel's feet; a triangular structure, possibly a pyramid, is seen between Andrew and Simon Peter; a domed structure appears below the rightmost angel's feet. These may be buildings or the roofs of buildings within the city.
Two pairs of palm trees with arching branches appear right a left. The pair on the left is left of the wall; the pair on the right stands before the wall.
The ground below the figures is covered with grass.

A small plant appears in the lower left corner of the design. The plant appears to have several branches and at least four flower buds or fruits. There is also an indication of vine-like tendrils extending from the plant.
Washes in the background indicate a sky at sunrise or sunset.

desc.objtitle: Mary at Her Distaff Watched Over by Two Angels, Object 4 (Butlin 544.4)

illustration.illusobjdesc: The Virgin Mary sits in a one-roomed building. The steeply pitched roof may be thatch. She faces forward with her head turned to the right; her eyes are raised and her mouth is slightly open. Mary's right arm is bent with her forearm extended to the left; her palm is held vertically and faces to the left. Her left arm is bent upward with her elbow resting on an object to her right; her palm faces out toward the viewer. Mary's distaff leans against the right wall of the building. Two gowned and winged angels fly or hover to the left and right of the building. Both are seen from behind and bend over the roof of the building with their heads down; they are likely looking at Mary. Palm trees grow to the left and right of the building, partially hidden by the angels. Their trunks are clearly visible, and several palm branches arch above the angels' heads. Two small, vine-like plants grow up the left and right walls of the building. The plant on the right bears four leaves. The plant on the left may be barren, though there is the indication of a single leaf outlined on the lowest branch. Grass covers the ground below the building. Blue wash along the top, left, and right margins of the design indicates sky.

component.illusobjdesc: The Virgin Mary sits in a small building in the center of the design. She is gowned and wears a cloth or scarf over her long hair. A halo of light surrounds her head. Mary faces forward with her head turned to the right; her eyes are raised and her mouth is slightly open. Mary's right arm is bent with her forearm extended to the left; her palm is held vertically and faces to the left. Her left arm is bent upward with her elbow resting on an object to her right; her palm faces out toward the viewer. The fingers on both hands are spread.
Mary's distaff leans against the right wall of the building. Her left elbow rests on a rectangular object, possibly made of cut stone. This may be part of the chair or bench on which she sits.
Mary sits in a one-roomed building, possibly a house. The steeply pitched roof may be made of thatch.

A winged angel flies or hovers to the left of the building. The angel is gowned and has long hair; a halo of light surrounds his head. He is seen from behind and twists or bends to the right along the slope of the roof. The angel's right leg is bent and drawn up; the soles of both feet are turned out toward the viewer. The angel's right arm is bent upward; his right hand may rest on his chest. The angel faces down and to the right; he is likely looking at Mary.

A winged angel flies or hovers to the right of the building. The angel is gowned and has long hair; a halo of light surrounds his head. He is seen from behind and twists to face left with his upper body bent slightly over the roof of the building. The angel's left leg is bent and drawn up; the soles of both feet are turned out toward the viewer. The angel's left arm is bent upward; his left hand may rest on his chest. The angel faces down and to the left; he is likely looking at Mary.
Palm trees grow to the left and right of the building, partially hidden by the angels. Their trunks are clearly visible, and several palm branches arch above the angels' heads.

Two small, vine-like plants grow up the left and right walls of the building. The plant on the right bears four leaves. The plant on the left may be barren, though there is the indication of a single leaf outlined on the lowest branch.
Grass covers the ground below the building.
Blue wash along the top, left, and right margins of the design indicates sky.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Satan sits, enthroned, on a set of stairs in the center of the design. He is nude and faces forward; his genitals are exposed, but there is a slight indication of scales covering them. Satan has large bat- or dragon-like wings spread behind his back. His eyes are raised and his mouth is open with the upper row of teeth visible; he is probably speaking to the crowd of figures to his left and right. Satan's arms are bent upward and he holds a tall staff or scepter in his left hand. A group of devils surrounds Satan. There are at least fourteen in all; perhaps four more appear as indistinct heads among the flames and smoke. Flames surround the columns of devils and rise to the left and right of Satan. Fire also appears on the steps of Satan's throne or pedestal. Dark wash above the figures suggests smoke. The tops of six raised spears appear above the flames to the left and right of Satan.

component.illusobjdesc: Satan sits, enthorned, on a set of stairs in the center of the design. He is nude, somewhat dark-skinned, and faces forward; his genitals are exposed, but there is a slight indication of scales covering them. Satan has large bat- or dragon-like wings spread behind his back. His eyes are raised and his mouth is open with the upper row of teeth visible; he is probably speaking to the crowd of devils to his left and right. His flame-like hair is spiky and stands on end. Satan sits with his left leg drawn up and his right leg bent and extended downward; his right foot is raised on tiptoe. Satan's arms are bent upward. His right arm is raised at approximately 135 degrees with the palm held out (facing the viewer) and the fingers spread. In his left hand, Satan holds a tall staff or scepter with a spherical finial.
Satan sits, enthroned, on a set of three steps or stairs.
A group of devils surrounds Satan. There are at least fourteen in all; perhaps four more appear as indistinct heads among the flames and smoke.

A head is visible in the fire left of Satan, the top figure in the column of devils on the left. It faces slightly to the right, its mouth slightly open. The figure may have two horns on top of its head; alternatively, this may be smoke or tongues of flame rising above the figure. The round shape just below this figure may be the head of another devil, minimally indicated.
The head of a figure appears in the fire left of Satan, the third figure from the top in the column of devils on the left. The figure is bald and only his or her upper face is visible.

The head and shoulders of a figure appears in the fire left of Satan. This figure is the one on the left in the group of two below the top three heads in the column of devils on the left. The figure is seen from behind and faces away with his or her head turned to the right. The figure has short hair and wears a shirt or other item of clothing.

The head of a figure appears in the fire left of Satan. This figure is the one on the right in the group of two below the top three figures in the column of devils on the left. The figure faces forward and has curly hair.

The head and upper body of a figure appears in the fire left of Satan, the second figure from the bottom of the column of devils on the left. The figure faces forward with his or her head turned to the right. The figure has long hair and wears a shirt or armor covered in scales. The figure points up and to the left with both hands, fingers spread. This figure may be looking at the devil at the bottom of the column of devils on the right.

A nude male devil hovers or lunges(?) to the left below and to the left of Satan, the bottom figure in the column of devils on the left. He is seen from behind and faces away from the viewer with his head turned to the right in profile. Both arms are bent upward with the palms turned out (away from the viewer) and his fingers spread. The figure's left leg is extended to the right with the sole of his left foot facing up. He may be looking angrily at the devil to the right, perhaps because this figure's spear has jabbed his left foot.

A nude male devil hovers below and to the right of Satan, the lowest figure in the column of devils on the right. The figure has long hair and his mouth is open; he may be speaking. He kneels on his right knee with his left leg bent and extended to the left; his upper body reclines or leans to the right. The figure's head and legs face to the left with his torso twisted to face forward. His right arm is bent upward with the palm facing out toward the viewer. His left arm is bent and his hand rests on (or holds) a spear, fingers spread. He may be looking at the devil to the left.

A nude(?) male devil is positioned in the fire below and to the right of Satan. He faces left with both arms bent upward; both hands are raised with the palms turned out, fingers slightly spread. The figure is old, with long hair and a beard. His expression and posture suggests surprise. He may be looking at the devil at the bottom of the column of figures on the left.

The head and right shoulder of a devil appear in the flames to the right of Satan. This is the figure on the left in the group of two above the two lowest figures in the column of devils on the right. The figure faces down and to the right. The figure's mouth may be slightly open; he or she may be speaking to the figure to the right.

The head and shoulders of a devil appear in the flames to the right of Satan. This is the figure on the right in the group of two above the two lowest figures in the column of devils on the right. The figure, with long(?) hair, is seen from behind and faces slightly towards another figure to the left.

The bearded head of an old male devil appears in the flames to the right of Satan, the figure just above and to the left of the lowest four figures in the column of devils on the right. He faces forward with his head tilted to the left.

The head of a devil appears in the flames to the right of Satan, the figure just above the lowest four figures in the column of devils on the right. The figure faces forward with his or her head tilted slightly to the left. The figure's mouth is open.

Several indistinct circles may represent the heads of other devils to the right of Satan at the top of the column of devils on the right. A pair of eyes and a nose, facing forward, marks the only clearly visible face in the group.
Flames surround the columns of devils and rise to the left and right of Satan. Fire also appears on the steps of Satan's throne or pedestal. Dark wash above the figures suggests smoke.
The tops of six raised spears appear above the flames to the left and right of Satan, three spears on each side.

lg.l: 5The faint shadow of the partly-erased number "5," written in pencil, appears just to the left of the ink number "5."

desc.objtitle: Christ Refusing the Banquet Offered by Satan, Object 6 (Butlin 544.6)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the right half of the design with a halo of light surrounding his head. His body faces forward, but his head is turned to the right, away from the other figures in the scene. His arms are bent and extend to the left with the palms held vertically. Satan—disguised as an old, bearded man—flies or hovers above the scene. He is upside down with his arms raised horizontally across the design. Satan holds a crown in his left hand. He is surrounded by spiky flames. Three erotic female figures dance to the left of Christ. The central figure is seen from behind and looks to the right towards Christ. She is gowned and her back and arms are covered in scales. The other two figures are nude and face forward with their arms linked in an arch above their heads. The left hand of the figure on the left can be seen holding the waist of the female on the right. All three figures stand on tiptoe and bend or arch to the left. Two ornate, divan-like couches appear behind Christ and the dancing figures. The couches are topped with cushions or pillows, and the bases are decorated with a pattern of leaves and flower buds or small fruit. A large banquet table extends to the left and right margins of the design above the couches. On the table are two lit candles in large candle sticks (far right and far left), a cup, three small plates, and two larger bowls or platters. The platter just to the left of Christ may contain food. In the central background, two nude female figures sit or recline on a pair of couches. Three pairs of winged angels fly or hover above the table in the background; the left and rightmost pairs are positioned above the candles and are rather minimally represented, particularly far right. The central pair appears just above the reclining figures. The central pair is more distinct than the others; the angels face each other in profile and may be praying. The scene is flanked by two leafy trees, each with a small sliver of their trunks visible along the left and right borders of the design. The ground below Christ and the dancing figures is covered in grass. Coloring at the top of the design indicates sky.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the right half of the design. His bare feet are visible below the hem of his gown. Christ is bearded and has long hair. A halo of light surrounds his head. Both arms are bent and extend to the left; his right palm is raised vertically, fingers slightly spread, while his left palm is turned out slightly towards the viewer. Christ's body faces forward, but his head is turned slightly to the right, away from the large banquet and other figures in the scene.

A gowned female dances to the left of Christ. She may be one of the "Nymphs of Diana's train" mentioned in the text. The body and sleeves of her garment are covered in scales. Tassels with spherical finials descend from the garment where it falls over her hips and her upper legs. She is seen from behind and her body bends or arches to the left with her feet raised on tiptoe. The figure's neck is twisted so that she faces to the right; she smiles and looks toward Christ. Her hair is short and curly. The figure's arms are down and held slightly away from her body at a bit less than 45 degrees. Both palms are vertical, fingers slightly spread, and face to the right.

Two nude females, their breasts prominent, dance to the left of Christ. They may be among the "Nymphs of Diana's train" mentioned in the text. The figure furthest to the left stands with her left(?) foot on tiptoe. Her body bends or arches to the left with her head twisted back to face right; she may look toward Christ. Her right arm is raised and bent over her head; she grasps the left wrist of the other nude female, forming an arch above their heads. The figure embraces her companion around the waist with her left hand. Her hair is short and curly.

Two nude females, their breasts prominent, dance to the left of Christ. They may be among the "Nymphs of Diana's train" mentioned in the text. The figure furthest to the right stands with her left foot on tiptoe; her right leg is bent and extends to the right. The figure faces forward. Her mouth is open and her long, curly hair falls to the right of her body. Her left arm is raised and bent around her head; she holds the right wrist of the other nude female, forming an arch above their heads.

Satan, disguised as an old man, flies or hovers in the top half of the design. He is upside down and seen from behind, facing down. Satan's lower body is twisted with his legs extending up and to the left and the soles of his feet turned out toward the viewer. He wears a gown and has long hair and a beard. His arms are raised horizontally with the palms held vertically and his fingers slightly spread. Satan holds a crown in his left hand, above Christ's head.
Satan holds a crown in his left hand, above Christ's head.
The figure of Satan is surrounded by spiky flames. Coloring to the left of Satan may also suggest smoke.
Coloring at the top of design indicates sky.

Two trees stand at the left and right borders of the design. Each has only a sliver of its trunk visible and a small suggestion of roots. Both have leafy tops, though the leaves on the left side of the design are more prominent.
The ground below Christ and the other figures is covered with grass.

Two ornate, divan-like couches are pictured in the middle distance to the left and right of Christ and the dancing figures. The couches are topped with cushions or pillows, and the bases are decorated with a pattern of leaves and flower buds or small fruit, possibly laurel.

A large banquet table expands across the design above the ornate couches. The table may be covered with a cloth bearing slight suggestions of a pattern where it falls over the edge of the table. Two candles in large candle sticks are pictured on the far left and right of the table; both are lit. Three small plates, two larger platters or bowls, and a short cup(?) also rest on the table. The bowl immediately to the left of Christ may contain food.

Two nude females, their breasts prominent, sit or recline in the background between Christ and the dancing figures. They may be among the "Nymphs of Diana's train" mentioned in the text. Both figures have long hair. The figure to the right faces right with her head turned back to the left. Her left arm is bent and rests on the raised edge of a couch. Her head may rest on her shoulder. She touches elbows with the figure to the left, who mirrors her pose. Both females may be smiling slightly.

Two gowned angels fly or hover on outstretched wings above the reclining females in the background of the scene. The angels face each other in profile. Each has a single visible arm bent in front of its chest; the pose suggests that the angels are praying.

Along the left margin of the design, a pair of angels fly or hover above the candle flame. Only their upper bodies are visible. The figures appear to face each other in a pose similar to that of the central pair of angels. The suggestion of a wing is visible on the angel to the right. Each angel may have a single arm bent in front of its chest as if in prayer. The angels are positioned more closely together than the central pair, and may be touching or kissing.

Suggestions of a third pair of angels appears along the right border of the design, just to the right of Christ's left shoulder. The figures appear only as indistinct heads, possibly each with a single arm visible below their heads. The figures may be touching.
A form in the top left corner of the design may simply be part of the tree below, but it looks a good deal like the head of a serpent facing up and to the right, mouth open and tongue extended.

lg.l: 6The faint shadow of a partly-erased number (possibly "6") or letter appears just to the left of the ink number "6."

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands on a single large stone—probably at the edge of a cliff or on top of a mountain—facing left. A halo of light surrounds his head. With his left hand he points down and to the left, possibly toward the images in the lower left corner of the design. His right hand points upward, perhaps toward heaven. Satan hovers or flies to the left of Christ. He is disguised as an old man with long hair and a beard. A halo with spiky beams of light surrounds his head. His mouth is open; he may be speaking. Satan faces forward with his torso twisted slightly to the left and his arms and knees bent. His right arm is down, and he points toward the images below with his right hand. His left arm is raised above his head and he points upward with his right hand, perhaps toward heaven. In the lower left corner of the design are a series of images or pictures inscribed within three circles or arches. The images are surrounded by radiance, projected outward as beams of light with a harsh shadow around the outer edge. The images represent the second temptation of Christ and depict the kingdoms of the earth.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ stands on a single large stone—possibly at the edge of a cliff or on top of a mountain—facing left. His left foot is visible below the hem of his gown. Christ has long hair and a beard. A halo of light surrounds his head. Both of Christ's arms are bent; the left is bent at 90 degrees while the right is bent upward. With his left hand he points down and to the left, possibly toward the images in the lower left corner of the design. His right hand points upward, perhaps toward heaven.
Christ stands on a single large stone, possibly at the edge of a cliff or on top of a mountain.
Blue wash indicates sky.

Satan hovers or flies to the left of Christ. He is disguised as an old man with long hair and a beard. A small halo crowns his head; lines suggesting beams of light radiate outward from his head. His mouth is open and he looks to the right toward Christ. Satan may be speaking. He wears a loincloth; his feet are prominent. Satan faces forward with his torso twisted slightly to the left and his arms and knees bent. His right arm is down, and he points toward the images below with his right hand. His left arm is raised above his head and he points upward with his left hand, perhaps toward heaven.

In the lower left corner of the design are a series of images or pictures inscribed within three circles or arches. The images are surrounded by radiance, projected outward as beams of light with a harsh shadow around the outer edge. The images represent the second temptation of Christ and depict three kingdoms of the earth, Parthia, Athens, and Rome.

The lower circle or arch depicts a king—or a statue of a king—seated on a throne raised on a plinth and facing forward. He is gowned and wears a crown or other headpiece. The figure may be bearded. His left arm rests at his side. His right arm is bent upward, and he holds a spear in his right hand.
A fire burns on an altar below the seated king depicted in the lower circle or arch.

At least two (but perhaps as many as six) gowned figures crouch or kneel at the base of the throne or statue in the lowest circle. Indistinct shapes to the left and right of the king suggest additional figures.
Vertical lines in the lowest circle may suggest additional spears to the left and right of the throne or statue. Alternatively, these may be spires of buildings in a city.

The vision in the middle arch depicts a figure or statue standing with its arms raised at 45 degrees and facing forward. The figure wears a triangular hat or crown. The figure's head and shoulders are surrounded by a large halo of light, or possibly backed by the sun.

At least two figures kneel or crouch to the left and right of the central figure in the middle arch. Each faces the central figure. A third figure stands to the left. The figure is hunched over and faces left. All three figures may be gowned. Indeterminate shapes left and right of the central figure may represent the heads of additional figures.

The vision in the upper arch depicts a walled(?) city, possibly on a hill. Vegetation—likely trees—appears to the left and right. Tall, triangular shapes—possibly additional trees, mountain peaks, spires, or flames—appear above the city and extend to the left and right.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ reclines against a grassy or mossy hill, bank, or mound in the lower right part of the design. His eyes are closed and he sleeps, dreaming. Satan flies or hovers on outstretched wings in the upper portion of the design with only his head, shoulder, and arms visible. A dark circle or halo appears above his head; this may also represent the moon. He holds a bolt of lighting and a coil of fire and smoke in his right hand. With his left hand he holds a second bolt of lighting and the body of a multi-headed serpent, or alternatively the bodies of three individual serpents. All three serpents' heads face down with their mouths open above Christ's head; the central serpent extends its tongue and the serpent furthest left has a single fang visible. A large snake or serpent with a spiky crest on its head rises to the left of Christ. The serpent faces right with its mouth open and tongue extended. A large snake or serpent appears on the ground below Christ. It is partially buried in the earth and may connect to the serpent tail above Christ's right leg. A snake, serpent, or worm appears on the ground below Christ's feet. The form lacks distinct features, and so may also represent a vine or other vegetation. A lion appears at the bottom right corner of th design. The large creature left of Christ's legs may be another lion or a tiger (both are named in the text).

component.illusobjdesc: Christ reclines against a grassy or mossy hill or mound in the lower right part of the design. He has long hair and a beard and wears a gown. His eyes are closed and he dreams as he sleeps. Christ's left arm is bent and rests on the hill, bank, or mound; his right arm is bent across his chest with the fingertips of his right hand touching or resting on his left forearm. Christ's body faces forward with his legs extended down and to the left; his legs are together and his feet may be touching.
Christ reclines against a hill, bank, or mound covered in vegetation—perhaps grass, moss, or lichens.

Satan flies or hovers on outstretched wings in the upper portion of the design with only his head, shoulder, and arms visible. Satan is here represented as an old man, but also a rain or storm god. He has long hair and a beard. He looks down and to the right towards Christ with his mouth open. A dark circle or halo appears above his head; this may also represent the moon. Satan's arms are outstretched horizontally and bent slightly upward at the elbows. He holds a bolt of lighting and a coil of fire and smoke in his right hand. With his left hand he holds a second bolt of lighting and the body of a multi-headed serpent, or alternatively the bodies of three individual serpents.

Dark coloring in the upper portion of the design suggests a storm at night. Satan holds a bolt of lighting and a spiraling coil of fire and smoke in his right hand. The lighting bolt reaches downward toward Christ and terminates near the body of a large snake to the right. Suggestions of a second bolt of lighting extend downward from Satan's left hand to the mound, bank, or hill just right of Christ's left elbow. Thick, slanting lines below Satan indicate rain.

A snake or serpent with three heads, or possibly three individual snakes, appear above Christ's head. The serpents' twisted body or bodies are held above in Satan's left hand. All three serpents' heads face down with their mouths open; the central serpent extends its tongue and the serpent furthest left has a single fang visible.

component.characteristic: A large snake or serpent with a spiky crest on its head rises to the left of Christ. Mottled coloring along the length of its body suggests scales. The serpent's body forms a single loop near the left border of the design. The serpent's head is positioned just to the left of Christ's head. The serpent faces right with its mouth open and tongue extended.

component.illusobjdesc: A large snake or serpent appears on the ground below Christ. It faces up with its mouth open. Mottled coloring along its body suggests scales. The serpent is partially buried in the earth; it may connect to the serpent tail above Christ's right leg.
A snake, serpent, or worm appears on the ground below Christ's feet. The form lacks distinct features, and thus might represent a vine or other vegetation.
The head a front legs of a lion extend from the lower right margin, facing left. Its mouth is open with the tongue and one tooth visible. The lion may be looking at Christ.

The head of a large beast, facing right, extends from the lower left margin. This may be either a lion or a tiger; both are named in the text. Its mane or fur is spiky above its head; a single tooth extends from its upper jaw. It may be looking at Christ.
Light blue-green coloring and a few horizontal lines slightly suggest a body of water, possibly a lake or stream, below Christ's feet.

lg.l: 8The ink number "8" is written over a partly-erased inscription in pencil, possibly "10."

desc.objtitle: Morning Chasing Away the Phantoms, Object 9 (Butlin 544.9)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ reclines on a grassy hill, bank or mound, facing right. Christ's arms are bent with his forearms and hands resting on the ground, palms down. His left leg and foot are visible through his gown. His eyes are raised and he looks toward the female personification of dawn, above and to the right. She walks or strides to the left and holds a staff in her left hand. Her right arm is raised horizontally and she may point leftward with her right hand. Her head is surrounded by a halo of light—likely the sun—with beams of light visible. A group of three nude males, personifications of clouds, flies or hovers above Christ's head; they are fleeing from the personification of dawn. A group of three devils—or a multi-headed devil—is pictured below Christ in the lower left corner of the image. These may personify the "winds" and "grisly spectres" named in the text and also displaced by dawn. The figures are buried in the earth; only their heads and arms are visible. The body of the central figure is covered in scales, and a reticulated worm or serpent extends to the left and right. The heads of two other figures are similarly buried in the earth above Christ's foot. A worm or serpent's tail extends to the left of these figures. All five figures look up and wear expressions of fear or surprise.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ reclines on a grassy hill, bank, or mound, facing right. He has long hair and a beard. His head is turned up slightly; his eyes are raised and he looks toward the personification of dawn, above and to the right. His mouth is slightly open. A halo with beams of light surrounds his head. Christ's arms are bent with his forearms and hands resting on the ground, palms down. His left leg and foot are visible through his gown.
Christ reclines on a grassy hill, bank, or mound. The personification of the dawn may be walking on a hill.

Above and to the right of Christ, a female figure walks or strides to the left. She represents a personification of the dawn. She has long hair and wears a gown (belted just below her breasts) and shoes. She may also wear a crown of leaves or flowers. Her head is surrounded by a halo of light—likely the sun—with beams of light visible. Her shoulders and head are bent slightly forward. Her right arm is raised horizontally; she may point leftward with her right hand. Her left arm is bent upward and she holds a staff with her left hand. The staff terminates in a spherical finial. She may pursue the figures to the left.

Coloring in the sky on the upper right portion of the image suggests sunrise. Clouds or smoke surround the three male figures to the left of the personification of dawn. A shadow or darkness appears in the upper left corner of the design.

A group of three nude male males flies or hovers above Christ's head. They are personifications of clouds fleeing from the personification of dawn. The rightmost figure of the group faces left with his head turned back to the right. His mouth is open and he has short, curly hair. His legs are bent and spread apart. His left arm is raised vertically with the palm turned out toward the viewer and the fingers slightly spread. His right arm is extended between the horizontal and 135 degrees and he holds the right arm of the winged figure to the left.

A group of three nude male figures flies or hovers above Christ's head. They are personifications of clouds fleeing from the personification of dawn. The leftmost figure of the group appears devilish because of his bat wings. He flies upside down and is seen from behind. His right leg is extended and arches or bends to the right; his left leg is not pictured. His arms are extending down and to the right; he holds the right arm of the rightmost devil with both hands and is probably pulling him upward.

A group of three nude male figures flies or hovers above Christ's head. They are personifications of clouds fleeing from the personification of dawn. The central figure in the group is seen from behind and faces away from the viewer. He has short, curly hair. His legs are bent and the sole of his left foot is turned towards the viewer. His right arm is raised horizontally and the fingers on his right hand may be spread. His left arm is raised at 135 degrees; his left hand is not pictured.

component.characteristic: A group of three devils—or a multi-headed devil—is pictured below Christ in the lower left corner of the image. These may be personifications of the "winds" and "grisly spectres" named in the text. The figures are buried in the earth; only their heads and two arms are visible. The head of the figure furthest left is buried up to its nose. To the right, the second figure's left shoulder is raised; her(?) left arm is bent and rests on the ground with her hand resting on the head to the left. The figure's back appears to be covered in scales. To the right, the third figure is old and has long hair and a beard. His left hand rests on top of his head. All three figures look up and to the right and wear expressions of fear or surprise. The reticulated body of a worm or serpent's tail extends out of the earth to the left and right; it may be a part of central figure with scales.

component.illusobjdesc: A group of two devils—or a multi-headed devil—is pictured above Christ's foot in the lower right portion of the image. These may be personifications of the "winds" and "grisly spectres" named in the text. The figures are buried in the earth; only their heads and two arms are visible. The head of the figure, possibly female, furthest right is bent back with its mouth open. Both hands are raised, palms vertical and fingers slightly spread. Her right arm may rest on the ground. The figure to the left is partially obscured. He is old and has long hair and possibly a beard. Both figures look up and wear expressions of fear or surprise. The body of a worm or serpent's tail extends to the left; it may be part of the multi-headed figure.
Coloring on the ground and a few lines suggest grass on the ground. The leaves of plants appear above and to the right of Christ's halo.

lg.l: 9.The ink number "9" is written over a partly-erased inscription in pencil, possibly a number containing two digits.

illustration.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design, Christ hovers or stands above a spire of a church or temple; only one toe of his right foot touches the structure. His arms are raised at 135 degrees with the palms turned out towards the viewer in a cruciform posture. A halo or aura surrounds his body with spiky beams of light emanating from the area near his head. Satan, again represented as an old man, falls upside down to the left of Christ. He is surrounded by flames and possibly smoke. His head is bent back to the left and his mouth is open. He holds sections of his long beard in each hand. A group of three winged angels hovers to the right of Christ. Only the head and wings of the uppermost angel are visible. Below, the central angel is gowned and holds his hands together in prayer. The lowest angel kneels with his head down and his arms extended downward and to the left. He may gesture toward the church or temple below.

component.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design, Christ hovers or stands above a spire of a church or temple; only one toe of his right foot touches the structure. He is gowned and has long hair and a beard. He faces forward with his head turned slightly left and his eyes raised. Christ's arms are raised at 135 degrees with the palms turned out towards the viewer. His posture is cruciform, perhaps in anticipation of his crucifixion, also suggested by a small line (stigmata?) on his right palm. A halo or aura surrounds his body with spiky beams of light emanating from the area near his head.

Satan, again represented as an old man, falls upside down to the left of Christ. He is surrounded by flames and possibly smoke. Satan has long hair and holds sections of his very long beard in each hand. His head is bent back to the left and his mouth is open with teeth visible; he may be speaking or crying out in pain, anger, or despair. His legs are bent with his right leg drawn up toward his body. Both feet are prominent.

A group of three winged angels hovers to the right of Christ. Only the head and wings of the uppermost angel are visible. The figure has short, curly hair. He faces forward and left and looks toward Christ.

A group of three winged angels appears to the right of Christ. Only the head and upper body of the central figure is visible. The angel is gowned and has long hair. His body faces forward with his head turned to the left; he looks left towards Christ. His mouth is slightly open. The angel's arms are bent with his hands together in prayer.

A group of three winged angels appears to the right of Christ. The lowest angel appears to kneel with his head down and his arms extended to the left. His palms are held vertically, with the right palm turned slightly towards the viewer. The fingers on both hands are slightly spread, and he may gesture to the church or temple below. The figure appears to be nude, but traces of drapery are visible below his right foot.

The decorative spires of a Gothic church are depicted at the bottom of the image. There are at least ten spires, most terminating in a fleur-de-lis. Christ stands upon the tallest spire, fifth from the left.
Blue wash suggests sky. A column of clouds or smoke appears just right of Christ.

desc.objtitle: Christ Ministered to by Angels, Object 11 (Butlin 544.11)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christ stands in the center of the image with his left foot emerging from the hem of his gown and resting on one of the angels below. His arms are raised at 45 degrees with the palms turned down and his fingers slightly spread. A halo surrounds his head. Two gowned and winged angels fly or hover to the left and right of Christ. Each holds a harp, and they may be singing. Below, two gowned angels fly or hover with their bodies horizontal; they may support Christ. Both are seen from behind with their heads turned to profile. The figure to the left offers Christ a basket of bread or fruit in his raised right hand; the figure to the right offers Christ a cup or goblet in his raised left hand. Wash in the sky suggests sunrise, sunset, or possibly the golden realm of heaven.

component.illusobjdesc: Christ appears in the center of the image, facing forward. He may be hovering, but also appears to stand on the two angels below; his left foot is visible beneath the hem of his gown. Christ is pictured with long curly hair and a beard. His eyes are raised and a halo surrounds his head. Christ's arms are raised at 45 degrees with the palms turned down and his fingers slightly spread.

A winged angel flies or hovers to the left of Christ. He is gowned and has short, curly hair. His body faces left, but his head is turned to the right. His mouth may be open and he may be singing. His left arm is bent upward; he holds and plays a harp with his left hand. The angel's left foot may touch Christ's gown.

A winged angel flies or hovers to the right of Christ. He is gowned and has long hair. His eyes are raised and he looks up and to the left, possibly towards Christ. His body faces right, but his head is turned to the left. His mouth is slightly open and he may be singing. His right arm is bent upward; he holds and plays a harp with his right hand. The angel's right foot may touch Christ's gown.

A winged angel flies below and to the left of Christ. He is seen from behind with his body twisted. His body is horizontal and faces left. His left foot is visible below the figure to the right; this suggests that his left leg is extended to the right, despite being obscured by the other figure. The angel is gowned and has long hair. His head is up and his eyes are raised; he looks up and to the right towards Christ. His right arm is bent upward and he holds a bowl or wicker basket in his right hand. The basket contains three round fruits or loaves of bread, which he offers or gives to Christ.

A winged angel flies below and to the right of Christ. He is seen from behind with his body twisted. His body is horizontal and faces left. His right foot is visible below the figure to the left; this suggests that his right leg is extended to the left, despite being obscured by the other figure. The angel is gowned and has long hair. His head is up and his eyes are raised; he looks up and to the left towards Christ. His left arm is bent upward and he holds a goblet in his left hand, which he offers or gives to Christ. His body may support Christ.
Washes in the upper two-thirds of the sky suggest sunrise, sunset, or perhaps the golden light of heaven.

lg.l: 11The ink number "11" is written over a partly-erased inscription in pencil, possibly the number "13."

desc.objtitle: Christ Returns to His Mother, Object 12 (Butlin 544.12)

illustration.illusobjdesc: The Virgin Mary stands in the center of the design, on the wooden(?) step or raised floor of a small building. A wooden(?) table or stool is visible within the building. Mary faces forward with her head tilted slightly to the right; she looks down and to the right towards Christ. Her mouth is open and she may be speaking. Her arms are spread and bent upward with the palms facing out toward the viewer. Christ stands below and to the right of Mary, facing right in profile. His eyes are raised and he looks up and to the left toward Mary. Christ's left leg is bent with his left foot raised on tiptoe; he may stride toward the left. His arms are bent upward with the palms held vertically but apart. Andrew and Simon Peter stand at the left and right borders of the design. The figure to the left faces forward and slightly right. He has short, curly hair and a beard. The figure's arms are bent upward with the palms turned out toward the viewer. The figure to the right faces forward and slightly left. He has long hair and a beard. The figure's arms are bent upward with his hands held together in prayer. The ground below the figures is covered with grass. Palm trees grow to the left and right of the building, partially hidden by the figures of Andrew and Simon Peter. Their trunks are clearly visible, and several palm branches arch above the roof of the building. The disc of the sun appears above the roof of the building and to the left of the leftmost palm tree. At least three beams of light extend outward from the sun into the sky.

component.illusobjdesc: The Virgin Mary stands in the center of the design, on the step or raised floor of a small building. She faces forward with her head tilted slightly to the right; she looks down and to the right towards Christ. A halo of light surrounds her head. Her mouth is open and she may be speaking. Mary is gowned and wears a cloth or scarf over her long hair. Her left foot is visible below the hem of her gown. Her arms are spread and bent upward with the palms facing out toward the viewer. The fingers of her right hand are slightly spread.
Mary stands on the step or raised wooden(?) floor of a one-roomed building (a cottage?), open on the front side. The steeply pitched roof may be thatched.
A wooden(?) table or stool is visible within the building.

Christ stands below and to the right of Mary. He is gowned and faces left in profile. He has long hair and a beard. His eyes are raised and he looks up and to the left toward Mary. Christ's left leg is bent with his left foot raised on tiptoe; he may stride toward the left. His arms are bent upward with the palms held vertically but apart. The fingers on both hands are slightly spread. A halo, or at least a suffusion of light, surrounds Christ's head.

A gowned male figure—either Andrew or Simon Peter—stands below and to the left of Mary. He faces forward and slightly right, and looks toward Christ. The figure has short, curly hair and a beard. His arms are bent upward with the palms turned out toward the viewer. The fingers of his left hand are slightly spread. His right foot is raised on tiptoe. A halo surrounds the figure's head.

A gowned male figure—either Andrew or Simon Peter—stands to the right of Christ. He faces forward and slightly left, and looks toward Christ. The figure has long hair and a beard. His arms are bent upward with the palms held together in prayer. Only his left foot is visible. A halo surrounds the figure's head.

Palm trees grow to the left and right of the building, partially hidden by the figures of Andrew and Simon Peter. Their trunks are clearly visible, and several branches arch above the roof of the building. There may be clusters of dates at the top of the palm trunks.
The ground below the figures is covered with grass.
The disc of the sun appears above the roof of the building and to the left of the leftmost palm tree. At least three beams of light extend outward from the sun into the sky.

lg.l: 12.The faint shadow of a partly-erased number, probably "14," appears just to the left of the ink number "12."
